ca.uqac.lif.labpal.table

Class GroupInColumns

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.labpal.table.GroupInColumns
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableTransformation

    public class GroupInColumns
extends Object
implements TableTransformation
    Creates columns from values of two parameters in an existing table. For example, consider this table:
    ABC
    013
    043
    121
    163
    291
    233
    Using the transfomration t = new GroupInColumns("A", "B") will produce this table:
    012
    129
    463
    Columns are the values of "A", and values in each column are those found in parameter "B" for rows with that particular value of "A".

    A common usage for this transformation is to use a table in a BoxPlot.

    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©
